title: Data Practices Request for Shady Oaks Apartment Complex Mass Shooting Records

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act (Minn. Stat. Ch. 13), I am requesting access to the following records related to the Shady Oaks Apartment Complex mass shooting in Albert Lea, Minnesota, on November 29, 2020:

- All body-worn camera recordings from officers who responded.
- All dashcam or in-car camera video.
- Any interview or interrogation room recordings related to this case.
- All 911 call audio, CAD dispatch logs, and radio communications from the incident.
- Complete incident, arrest, investigative, and supplemental reports.
- Any evidence photos or video collected during the investigation.

If any portion of these records is exempt, I request release of all reasonably segregable material and a written explanation of any redactions or denials, citing statutory authority.
This request is made for journalistic/documentary purposes, and disclosure of these records is in the public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Shaw

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to formally request access to video footage from a police intervention, specifically from the body camera worn by the officer(s) and the dashcam of the police vehicles involved. Article:
https://www.ksla.com/2025/05/19/woman-arrested-after-reportedly-shoving-officer-into-window-resisting-arrest/

Exact date of incident: May 16, 2025
Names of parties involved: Quashayvea Washington

I intend to use this footage solely for educational purposes to promote a better understanding of law enforcement procedures and the application of the law.

I understand that there may be associated costs for providing this footage, and I am more than willing to cover any fees incurred. Please inform me about the necessary procedures and the costs involved.

Thank you in advance for your assistance. I trust that this footage will be invaluable for my educational efforts, and I greatly appreciate your cooperation.


Best regards,
George Smith

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

George Smith

title: GRAMA Request for Dylan Rounds Case Records

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Government Records Access and Management Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to Utah’s Government Records Access and Management Act (GRAMA, Utah Code § 63G-2), I respectfully request the following records related to the disappearance and murder of Dylan Rounds in Box Elder County (May 2022 – April 2024), including the prosecution of suspect James Brenner:

- All body-worn camera recordings from responding or investigating officers.
- All dashcam or in-car camera video.
- Any interview or interrogation room recordings (audio or video).
- All 911 call recordings, CAD dispatch logs, and radio communications related to the case.
- Complete incident, arrest, investigative, and supplemental reports.
- Any evidence photos or videos collected during the investigation.

If any portion of these records is exempt from disclosure, please release all reasonably segregable portions and provide the statutory basis for any redactions.

This request is being made for journalistic/documentary purposes, and the disclosure of these records is in the public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

James Shaw

title: 287 (g) contracts and memos with Rutherford County, Tennessee (U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, Office of the Principal Legal Advisor [APPEALS])

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All contracts, agreements and memoranda between I.C.E. and Rutherford County Sheriff's Department in Tennessee from 2003 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bill Hayduke
